diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Coronary artery disease and acute myocardial infarction in a woman with HIV infection.
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Coronary vasospasm, coronary dissection, coronary embolus, aortic dissection with coronary occlusion, pericarditis, myocarditis, stress-induced cardiomyopathy.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with classic symptoms consistent with myocardial ischemia, supported by ECG findings showing ST-segment elevation and depression, which pointed towards acute myocardial infarction due to coronary artery disease. Traditional risk factors such as dyslipidemia and a family history of heart disease, coupled with her HIV status, likely contributed to her presentation.
